sys_metadata_link.payload:
Mapping has been proposed
First version of API documentation has been delivered.

Architect notes:
- study how incidents work in ServiceNow and find common logic between them and the complaints in System X (for example fulfilled -> status)
- for documentation use swaggerhub and define each endpoint on each side and the necessary fields in the payloads and examples

]]> true false not requested ca8c03c0932b02100580f55a7bba10e7 product false automatic Feature false Hello, the System X has been developed a long time ago with different concepts in mind than current systems support. It's easier in its structure as well in its functionality. Your architect has sent me a bunch of questions and I will try to answer them today. Users: - these are created manually by our IT department in System X - we want to keep System X going and we want to be able to create users in one of the systems whilst having them synchronized in both - roles can be : admin - can create other users, user - can log tickets and write notes into them, technician - can process tickets Ticket type: - we have different kinds of tickets in this system, some are for improvements, some are complaints - right now we only want to synchronise complaints with ServiceNow Ticket: - your architect has asked us if we could extend the table to store some kind of external ID from ServiceNow and we can confirm that we can do so - header -> this is a small description of the ticket - content -> full text content of the ticket - fulfilled - > true/false is filled in when the technician closes the ticket - we currently have 500 tickets, 300 of those are closed complaints -> we would like to import these complaints into the system as well Architect commentary: - there are several ways to synchronise users -> here we can ask the customer if they would be okay with their employees to login to ServiceNow, so that users are managed in one place + we will have to sync these users via another endpoint - admin role -> could be a role in our system which grants users the possibility to create users, user -> user doesn't need a role in ServiceNow to submit an incident, technician -> this sounds like the itil role in ServiceNow - since the requirement is to only synchronise complaints, we can probably just synchronise them with incidents in ServiceNow (we need to confirm, that complaint = incident with the customer) - we need to be careful about the data types -> some fields might containt UTF-8 characters or their lenght might be different from our fields 1970-01-02 00:00:00 2022-08-27 2022-08-27 10:24:49 66190f4c93e702100580f55a7bba10f7 0 4211100000 false 2 false false true false STRY0019326 2022-08-27 10:24:49 86a02d641b52451058592024b24bcb07 false ad21d748932b02100580f55a7bba107f 0 4 3398874c93e702100580f55a7bba10c0 1500000 20a707c893e702100580f55a7bba10fa 1700000 35288bc893e702100580f55a7bba1092 1 false true 2022-08-27 10:24:49 2022-08-27 10:24:49 false Project X technical analysis ad21d748932b02100580f55a7bba107f 200000 2022-08-27 2022-08-27 10:24:49 1 green rm_story admin.peter.kadlec 2022-08-27 10:25:55 global / dc6d33f147e9dd108c98dd1a536d43ff 10 admin 2024-07-17 19:21:42 Project X technical analysisâ€‹STRY0019326 STRY0019326 false asap 20a707c893e702100580f55a7bba10fa Documentation proceed cancel 3
